title: Vampire Manor Adventure #47
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Foyer
rooms.description: A vast entrance hall with a vaulted ceiling disappearing into shadow. Moonlight streams through stained glass windows depicting scenes of ancient battles. A grand staircase curves upward, and portraits of pale aristocrats line the walls. The air is cold and smells of dust and decay. Cobwebs hang from an enormous chandelier overhead.

items.name: ornate side table
items.description: An elegant table with carved legs and a marble top

items.name: brass key
items.description: A small brass key with an ornate handle shaped like a bat

items.name: portrait of Count Vladimir
items.description: A large oil painting of a pale nobleman with piercing red eyes
items.text: Count Vladimir Drăculești - Born 1456, Master of this Manor. 'The night is eternal, and so am I.'

items.name: portrait of Lady Elena
items.description: A painting of an elegant woman in a crimson gown
items.text: Lady Elena - Beloved companion of the Count. 'She who walks in moonlight and dwells in the garden of eternal roses.'

items.name: portrait of Lord Marcus
items.description: A dark portrait of a stern man holding a goblet
items.text: Lord Marcus - Keeper of the Blood Cellar. 'Guardian of the crimson vintage, protector of the ancient stores.'

items.name: glass display cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing various artifacts and curiosities

items.name: manor history book
items.description: A leather bound tome detailing the manor's dark past
items.text: The Manor was built in 1456 by Count Vladimir. The family crest bears three symbols: the bat, the rose, and the chalice. The Count's private study contains his most precious secrets, locked away from prying eyes.

items.name: heavy oak door
items.description: A massive wooden door leading to the study, reinforced with iron bands

rooms.name: Count's Study
rooms.description: A dimly lit study filled with ancient books and scrolls. A massive desk dominates the room, covered in papers written in archaic script. Candles flicker in wall sconces, casting dancing shadows. The walls are lined with bookshelves reaching to the ceiling. A strange symbol is carved into the floor, and a heavy iron chest sits in the corner. Stone stairs descend into darkness.

items.name: mahogany writing desk
items.description: An imposing desk with multiple drawers and compartments

items.name: journal of Count Vladimir
items.description: A personal diary written in elegant script
items.text: Entry from 1456: I have completed the manor this year. The crypt below holds the key to my immortality. Only those who know my true nature may enter: I am Vladimir, I rest in the Blood Cellar, and I am sustained by the crimson essence.

items.name: ancient bookshelf
items.description: Shelves packed with dusty tomes on dark subjects

items.name: codex of the undead
items.description: A forbidden text describing vampire lore
items.text: Chapter VII: The vampire sustains itself through blood, the crimson essence of life. They rest in crypts and cellars, away from the burning sun. Holy symbols and garlic are their bane.

items.name: ironbound chest
items.description: A heavy chest reinforced with iron bands and a sturdy lock

items.name: iron key
items.description: A large iron key with teeth shaped like fangs

items.name: silver cross
items.description: A holy cross made of pure silver, warm to the touch

items.name: map of the crypt
items.description: A detailed map showing the layout of the underground crypt
items.text: The crypt contains the Count's resting place and the secret passage to freedom. The escape tunnel leads to the forest beyond the manor walls. Only the silver cross can unlock the final barrier.

items.name: stone staircase to crypt
items.description: Ancient stone steps descending into darkness. A stone door at the bottom is covered in carved questions.

password_questions.question: What is the name of the manor's master?
password_questions.hint: Check the portraits in the foyer and the journal

password_questions.question: Where does the master rest?
password_questions.hint: The portraits mention where Lord Marcus guards, and the journal confirms this

password_questions.question: What sustains the undead?
password_questions.hint: The vampire codex and journal both mention this

rooms.name: Ancient Crypt
rooms.description: You have descended into the heart of the manor. The crypt is a vast underground chamber with stone sarcophagi lining the walls. In the center rests an ornate coffin on a raised platform. Torches burn with an eerie green flame. The air is thick with the scent of earth and age. On the far wall, a heavy door bears a cross-shaped indentation and promises escape.

items.name: ornate coffin
items.description: An elaborate coffin made of dark wood with silver inlays

items.name: ancient sarcophagi
items.description: Stone tombs bearing the names of long-dead nobles
items.text: Here lie the ancestors of House Drăculești: Count Radu, Lady Mirela, Lord Stefan, and countless others who walked the night.

items.name: escape door
items.description: A reinforced door with a cross-shaped lock. This is the way out of the manor.

rooms.name: Forest Path
rooms.description: You emerge from a hidden tunnel into a moonlit forest. Fresh air fills your lungs as you leave the cursed manor behind. Through the trees, you can see the lights of a distant village. The nightmare is over, and you are free.

items.name: winding forest path
items.description: A dirt path leading away from the manor toward civilization

items.name: village lights
items.description: Warm lights twinkling in the distance, promising safety and sanctuary

rooms.win_message: You have escaped the Vampire Manor! As you flee through the forest, you hear an inhuman shriek from the manor behind you. The silver cross in your hand grows warm, protecting you from any pursuit. You reach the village as dawn breaks, and the manor's dark influence fades. You have survived the night and uncovered the secrets of Count Vladimir. You win!
